definition: unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Can't you sense the hidden meaning? It's more than a joke.
sentences.chinese: 難道你沒聽出言外之意嗎？這不只是一個笑話。

sentences.english: Try to hear the meaning behind the words without presuming you already know.
sentences.chinese: 不要不懂裝懂，儘量聽出言外之意。

sentences.english: "Connotation" is the implied meaning, similar to "implication" and "implicature".
sentences.chinese: “內涵”就是隱含或意涵，相當於“言外之意”。

sentences.english: The implication is to curry favour, benefits from fish.
sentences.chinese: 阿諛奉承，其言外之意就是要從中撈取好處。

sentences.english: That's the idea behind that exercise.
sentences.chinese: 這個練習的言外之意在此。

sentences.english: But you won't need to read between the lines.
sentences.chinese: 而你不需要猜測我的言外之意。

sentences.english: But in Afghanistan, the idea of nation has very different overtones.
sentences.chinese: 但在阿富汗，國家這個概念有着非常不同的言外之意。

sentences.english: He gave a long account of his troubles, with the implication that he needed financial aid.
sentences.chinese: 他擺了一大堆困難，言外之意是需要補助。

sentences.english: In other words, it's a product of waiting around for the playoffs to start.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意，這就是說他們只是在坐等季後賽開打。

sentences.english: So the analysis of the speech event is another way for studying more illocutionary acts.
sentences.chinese: 對言語活動的分析是研究更多言外之意的另一種途經。

sentences.english: Figure out the meaning of someone's words.
sentences.chinese: 要懂得說話者的言外之意。

sentences.english: The implication was that the writing was clearly on the wall for minor argots.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意是，刻畫在牆上的文字是一些微小的暗語。

sentences.english: Alcohol is ( a ) taboo in this tribe.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意就是百無禁忌。

sentences.english: Man does not live by bread alone.
sentences.chinese: 言外之意是，人不能只追求物質生活。

sentences.english: I gather by what you have not said that he's an unmitigated scoundrel .
sentences.chinese: 聽你的言外之意，他是個不折不扣的惡棍。

definition: unspoken dialogue in a play, left for the audience to infer/subtext/(fig.) implicit assertion
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
idea/opinion/meaning/wish/desire/interest/fun/token of appreciation, affection etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to give as a small token/to do sth as a gesture of goodwill etc
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
